intro: Secamone blumei, commonly known as the blue secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It produces small, elliptical berries that are typically yellow or red when mature. Secamone blumei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
